DETAILS: The Board at their meeting held on 27th April, 2023, recommended a final dividend of Rs. 22/- for the financial year ended 31st March, 2023 on Equity Shares of Re. 1/- each. The Company had earlier paid an interim dividend of Rs. 17/- per share on 17th November, 2022. The total dividend for the said period amounts to Rs. 39/- per Equity Share of face value of Re. 1/- each.

SUBJECT: Diversification/Disinvestment
DETAILS: Hindustan Unilever Limited has informed the Exchange that the Company letter dated July 18, 2016 wherein, the exchange was informed that the Board of Directors have approved Hindustan Unilever Limitedￂﾒs (the Company) intension to divest its shareholding in Kimberly-Clark Lever Private Limited (KCL). Pursuant to the requirements of the Listing Regulations, we wish to inform that in line with the decision of the Board, the Company has today signed an agreement for divestment of its 50% shareholding in KCL in favour of Kimberly-Clark Corporation (KCC), USA. This decision is in line with the Companyￂﾒs objective to focus on its core business. Accordingly, KCL shall cease to be a Joint Venture of the Company. KCL was formed as a Joint Venture Company in 1995, bringing together the Companyￂﾒs strengths in sales and distribution and category expertise from KCC. The Company has enjoyed a long standing partnership with KCC for over two decades and have together built a strong foundation for the Baby & Child Care and Feminine care business in India under the brands ￂﾑHuggiesￂﾒ and ￂﾑKotexￂﾒ respectively. The Company shall work with KCC to ensure a smooth transition for the business.

SUBJECT: Reply to Clarification Sought
DETAILS: The Exchange had sought clarification from Hindustan Unilever Limited with respect to an announcement submitted to the Exchange dated August 16, 2016, regarding a press release dated August 16, 2016 titled "Unilever to Acquire Blueair".The reply from the Company is attached.

SUBJECT: Clarification
DETAILS: HINDUNILVR:The Exchange has sought clarification from Hindustan Unilever Limited with respect to an announcement submitted to the Exchange dated August 16, 2016, regarding a press release dated August 16, 2016 titled "Unilever to Acquire Blueair".On basis of above Company are required to clarify following -1. Whether the acquisition would fall within related party transactions and whether the promoter/ promoter group/ group companies have any interest in the entity being acquired? If yes, nature of interest and details thereof and whether the same is done at "arm's length";2. Objects and effects of acquisition;3. Brief details of any governmental or regulatory approvals required for the acquisition;4. Indicative time period for completion of the acquisition;5. Cost of acquisition or the price at which the shares are acquired if any;6. Nature of consideration - whether cash consideration or share swap and details of the same;7. Percentage of shareholding / control acquired and / or number of shares acquired if any;8. Brief background about the entity acquired in terms of products/line of business acquired, date of incorporation, history of last 3 years turnover, country in which the acquired entity has presence and any other significant information (in brief).The response of the Company is awaited.

SUBJECT: Clarification
DETAILS: The Exchange had sought clarification from Hindustan Unilever Limited with respect to announcement dated March 23, 2015 regarding "Pursuant to a Share Purchase Agreement with M/s Brigade Properties Pvt. Ltd., the Company has divested its entire shareholding in Brooke Bond Real Estates Private Limited (BBREPL), a wholly owned subsidiary of the Company, in favour of M/s Brigade Properties Pvt. Ltd., a subsidiary of M/s Brigade Enterprises Ltd. Consequently, BBREPL ceased to be a subsidiary of the Company with effect from March 23, 2015". The Company has clarified as follows:  1. Brooke Bond Real Estates Private Limited (BBREPL) was a wholly owned subsidiary of Hindustan Unilever Limited. The financial position of BBREPL as at March 31, 2014 was as follows :  As on March 31, 2014  Share Capital 1,29,460,000  Reserves and Surplus (1,03,068,000)  Please note that BBREPL was not a material subsidiary of HUL and was not engaged in any business activity. The Company had a pre-tax loss of Rs. 187.24 lacs as on March 31, 2014.   2. The Share Purchase Agreement as referred in our letter was signed on March 23, 2015.   3. Hindustan Unilever Limited held 1,29,46,000 equity shares of the face value of Rs. 10/- each in BBREPL. The Company has sold the said shares at Rs. 140.52 per equity share.  4. The Company has entered into a Share Purchase Agreement with Brigade Properties Private Ltd, a subsidiary of Brigade Enterprises Ltd. Brigade Properties Pvt Ltd (BPPL) is a joint venture between Brigade Enterprises Ltd. and Government of Singapore Investment Corporation Pte Ltd (GIC Singapore).  5. The transaction does not fall within the Related Party Transaction as the transaction was with an unrelated party.

SUBJECT: Clarification
DETAILS: The Exchange has sought clarification from Hindustan Unilever Limited with respect to announcement dated March 23, 2015 regarding "Pursuant to a Share Purchase Agreement with M/s Brigade Properties Pvt. Ltd., the Company has divested its entire shareholding in Brooke Bond Real Estates Private Limited (BBREPL), a wholly owned subsidiary of the Company, in favour of M/s Brigade Properties Pvt. Ltd., a subsidiary of M/s Brigade Enterprises Ltd. Consequently, BBREPL ceased to be a subsidiary of the Company with effect from March 23, 2015".    On basis of above Company is required to clarify the following:   1. The Amount and percentage of the turnover or revenue or income or Net worth contributed by such Entity.  2. Date on which the agreement has been entered into;  3. Consideration from such divestment;  4. Brief Details of Buyers and whether any of the buyers belong to promoter/promoters group, If yes details thereof;   5. Whether transaction fall within Related Party Transaction.    The reply from the Company is awaited.

Ltd., a subsidiary of M/s Brigade Enterprises Ltd. Consequently, BBREPL ceased to be a subsidiary of the Company with effect from March 23, 2015.

SUBJECT: Change in Director(s)
DETAILS: Hindustan Unilever Limited has informed the Exchange that Mr. Sridhar Ramamurthy, presently Executive Director Finance & IT and CFO of HUL has been appointed Senior Vice President Finance for the Global Markets. He will be part of the Global Markets Executive of Unilever and based in London.    Mr. P. B. Balaji, presently, Vice President, Finance, Unilever Americas Supply Chain Company will succeed Mr. Sridhar as Executive Director Finance & IT and CFO of HUL. He will join the Board of Directors of HUL and will be part of the Management Committee of HUL. Mr. Balaji's appointment was approved by the Board of Directors of HUL on March 11, 2014 after the Nomination & Remuneration Committee recommended his name to the Board. The appointment approved by the Board is subject to such statutory approvals as may be applicable. Mr. Balaji joined HUL in May 1993 and has worked in different roles in HUL. Prior to moving to Unilever in 2011, Mr. Balaji was Vice President, Finance for the Home & Personal Care Business of HUL.    The Changes are effective from July 01, 2014. The board places on record its appreciation for the contribution made by Mr. Sridhar Ramamurthy.

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Hindustan Unilever Limited has informed the Exchange that the Company has on July 26, 2013 announced key changes in the Board of Directors and Management Committee of HUL Mr. Nitin Paranjpe, currently the Managing Director and Chief Executive Officer of the Company will be joining the Unilever Leadership Executive (ULE), taking on the role of President, Home Care with effect from October 01, 2013. Mr. Sanjiv Mehta, currently Chairman, North Africa & Middle East (NAME), Unilever, has been appointed as the Managing Director and Chief Executive Officer of the Company in place of Mr. Nitin Paranjpe with effect from October 01, 2013. The appointment has been approved by the Board of Directors of the Company at its meeting on July 26, 2013 after the Nominations & Remuneration Committee of the Board had recommended the same to the Board and will be subject to the approval of the Shareholders. Mr. Sanjiv Mehta will also be responsible for South Asia cluster which includes India, Pakistan, Sri Lanka, Bangladesh and Nepal.

SUBJECT: Press Release
DETAILS: HSBC Securities and Capital Markets (India) Private Limited has submitted to the Exchange a copy of the press release by the Acquirer with respect to Voluntary Open Offer by Unilever PLC (the  Acquirer ) along with Unilever N.V. in its capacity as person acting in concert (the  PAC ) with the Acquirer, to the public shareholders of Hindustan Unilever Limited (the  Target Company ) to acquire 487,004,772 equity shares ( Shares ), pursuant to SEBI (Substantial Acquisition of Shares and Takeovers) Regulations, 2011 (the  Open Offer ).

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: HSBC Securities and Capital Markets (India) Pvt Ltd ("Manager to the Open Offer") on behalf of the Unilever PLC ("Acquirer ) along with Unilever N.V. in its capacity as person acting in concert (the PAC ) has informed this Announcement to the equity shareholders of the Hindustan Unilever Ltd ("Target Company"), pursuant to Regulation 18(7) of the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Substantial Acquisition of Shares and Takeovers) Regulations 2011, as amended (the  SEBI (SAST) Regulations, 2011 ), in respect of the Voluntary open offer (the  Open Offer ) for acquisition of 487,004,772 Shares representing 22.52% of the Voting Share Capital from the Shareholders of the Target Company. The detailed public statement ( DPS ) with respect to the Open Offer was published on May 08, 2013. Capitalised terms used but not defined in this Advertisement shall have the meaning assigned to such terms in the Letter of Offer.

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Hindustan Unilever Limited has informed the Exchange regarding recommendation of Independent Directors Committee on Voluntary Open Offer.

SUBJECT: Open Offer
DETAILS: HSBC Securities and Capital Markets (India) Pvt Ltd ("Manager to the Open Offer") on behalf of the Unilever PLC ("Acquirer") along with Unilever N.V. in its capacity as person acting in concert (the "PAC") has informed this Detailed Public Statement ("DPS") the public shareholders of the Hindustan Unilever Limited ("Target Company"), in compliance with Regulation 6 read with Regulations 13(4), 14 and 15(2) of the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Substantial Acquisition of Shares and Takeovers) Regulations, 2011 (SEBI (SAST) Regulations, 2011"), pursuant to the Public Announcement ("PA") filed on April 30, 2013 with the BSE Limited ("BSE"), the National Stock Exchange of India Limited ("NSE"), the Securities and Exchange Board of India ("SEBI") and the Target Company in terms of Regulation 6 of the SEBI (SAST) Regulations, 2011. The Offer: This Open Offer is for the acquisition of 487,004,772 Shares representing 22.52% of the Voting Share Capital of the Target Company. The price being offered under this Open Offer is INR 600 (Rupees six hundred) per Share (the "Open Offer Price"), in accordance with Regulation 8 of the SEBI (SAST) Regulations, 2011. The Open Offer Price will be payable in cash by the Acquirer, in accordance with the provisions of Regulation 9(1)(a) of the SEBI (SAST) Regulations, 2011. Tentative Schedule of Activity: Identified Date - June 07, 2013; Date of Commencement of tendering period - June 21, 2013; Date of Closing of tendering period - July 04, 2013.

SUBJECT: Outcome of Board Meeting
DETAILS: Hindustan Unilever Limited has informed the Exchange that the Board of Directors at their meeting held on May 03, 2013 has taken note of the Voluntary Open Offer for acquisition of 22.52% of the Voting Share Capital of the Company, made by Unilever PLC along with Unilever NV in its capacity as person acting in concert with the Acquirer. Further, in terms of the requirements of Regulation 26(6) the SEBI (Substantial Acquisition of Shares and Takeovers) Regulations, 2011 the Board of Directors has constituted the Independent Directors Committee to provide reasoned recommendation to the shareholders on the Voluntary Open Offer from the Acquirer. The Committee shall consist of all Independent Directors of the Company, i.e. Mr. Aditya Narayan, Mr. S. Ramadorai, Dr. R. A. Mashelkar, Mr. O. P. Bhatt and Dr. Sanjiv Misra and Mr. Aditya Narayan shall act as the Chairman of the Committee.

SUBJECT: Open Offer
DETAILS: HSBC Securities and Capital Markets (India) Private Limited, Manager to the Open Offer, has informed the Exchange that, Unilever PLC (the "Acquirer") along with Unilever N.V. in its capacity as person acting in concert (the "PAC") is making a voluntary open offer to acquire 487,004,772 Shares representing 22.52% of the total Voting Share Capital from the public shareholders of Hindustan Unilever Limited (the "Target Company"). Further, HSBC Securities and Capital Markets (India) Private Limited has submitted to the Exchange the public announcement ("PA") under Regulation 6, Regulation 13(3) and Regulation 15(1) of the SEBI (Substantial Acquisition of Shares and Takeovers) Regulations, 2011 (the "SEBI (SAST) Regulations. 2011").

Mr. Parekh was also the Chairman of the Audit Committee. Mr. Parekh has during his long tenure lasting more than 14 years as an Independent Director, made significant contribution to the Company and has now chosen to step down given several other commitments that he has. The Board acknowledges and places on record the contribution made by Mr. Deepak Parekh during this period of more than 14 years.

SUBJECT: Appointment of Director
DETAILS: Hindustan Unilever Limited has informed the Exchange that Mr. O. P. Bhatt, former Chairman of the State Bank of India has been appointed as an Independent Director on the Board of the Company with effect from December 20, 2011. The Board of Directors has, on December 20, 2011, approved the appointment of Mr. O. P. Bhatt as an Independent Director. Mr. O. P. Bhatt (aged 60) started his banking career with State Bank of India in 1972 and during 36 years with SBI, has held several important assignments in India and abroad. The Bank has, under the leadership of Mr. Bhatt, steadily improved its Global ranking in the list of Fortune 500 companies. Mr. Bhatt was nominated the "Banker of the Year" by Business Standard and CNN-IBN Indian of the Year for Business in 2007.

SUBJECT: Corrigendum
DETAILS: HSBC Securities and Capital Markets (India) Private Limited has submitted to the Exchange a copy of the Corrigendum to the Public Announcement as published in the newspapers on August 21, 2010 with respect to Buy back of Equity Shares of Hindustan Unilever Limited.

SUBJECT: Public Announcement - Buyback of Shares
DETAILS: HSBC Securities and Capital Market (India) Private Limited has informed to the Exchange regarding the Public Announcement made pursuant to the provisions of regulation 8(1) read with regulation 15(c) of the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Buy Back of Securities) Regulations, 1998, as amended and contains disclosures as specified in Schedule II to these regulations. Further the Hindustan Unilever Limited ("HUL" or the "Company") hereby announces its intention to Buy-back its fully paid-up equity shares of face value of Re. 1/- each ("Equity Shares") from the existing registered shareholders/beneficial owners of the Equity Shares of HUL ("Buy-back") through the open market using the nationwide electronic trading facilities of the Bombay Stock Exchange Limited ("BSE") and the National Stock Exchange of India Limited ("NSE") pursuant to Article 169A of the Articles of Association of the Company and in accordance with Sections 77A, 77AA and 77B of the Companies Act, 1956 (the Act") and the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Buy Back of Securities) Regulations, 1998 ("the Buy-back Regulations") at a price not exceeding Rs. 280/- per Equity Share ("Maximum Buy-back Price") payable in cash, for an aggregate amount not exceeding Rs. 630 crores ("Offer Size") i.e. within 25% of the Company's fully paid-up Equity Share Capital and Free Reserves as per the Audited Balance Sheet as on March 31, 2010. The maximum Buy-back Price of Rs. 280/- has been arrived at after taking in to account the trends in the market price of the Equity Shares of the Company during the last six months prior to the date of the Board Meeting. The average closing market price of the Equity Shares the last three calendar months prior to June 11, 2010 (being the date of the Board Meeting in which the proposal of Buy-back was approved), on the BSE was Rs. 232.81 and on the NSE was Rs. 233.07. The maximum Buy-back Price of Rs. 280/- is at a premium of approximately 20% over the aforesaid prices. Date of commencement of the Buy-back - August 23, 2010. Last Date for the Buy-back - (a) July 25, 2011 (i.e. 12 months from date of the Special Resolution passed by the shareholders of the Company via Postal Ballot) or (b) When the Company completes the Buy-back to the extent of authorised amount of Rs. 630 crores or (c) at such other earlier date as may be determined by the Board or Committee thereof, after giving notice for such earlier closure. The Company will, however, complete the Buy-back of minimum of 56,25,000 Equity Shares, within the Maximum Buy Back Price before announcing such earlier closure. All payment obligations relating to the Buy-back offer shall be completed before the Last Date for the Buy-back.

HFS was incorporated for building capabilities for 'in-store' execution in Modern Trade and operates as a dedicated venture with processes, capability and culture of execution. The Board of Directors of the Company have now agreed to divest 43.31% stake in HFS in favour of Smollan Group, who are currently holding 49% stake in HFS. HUL will continue to hold 7.69% shareholding of HFS and accordingly HFS will cease to be a subsidiary of the Company.

SUBJECT: Appointment/Others
DETAILS: Hindustan Unilever Limited has informed the Exchange that the Board of Directors of the Company, by a resolution passed by circulation, has approved the appointment of Mr. Dev Bajpai as Company Secretary and Compliance Officer of the Company with effect from June 01, 2010. Mr. Dev Bajpai will succeed Mr. Ashok Gupta as Executive Director Legal and Company Secretary, who consequent to his resignation ceases to be Company Secretary of the Company effective ApriI 01, 2010. Mr. Dev Bajpai, currently Senior Director - Legal & Compliance with ICICI Venture, is a qualified legal professional and a Company Secretary. He has 22 years of experience in different organizations including Marico Ltd., Indian Hotels Company Ltd. and Maruti Udyog Ltd. The Board of Directors has also approved the appointment of Mr. Sridhar Ramamurthy, CFO and Executive Director - Finance & IT of the Company, as Company Secretary and Compliance Officer for the interim period from April 01, 2010 until May 31, 2010 .

SUBJECT: Divestment
DETAILS: Hindustan Unilever Limited has informed the Exchange that "Pursuant to the terms of agreement entered between Hindustan Unilever Limited (HUL) and Cap Gemini SA in October 2006, HUL has divested its remaining 49% stake in Capgemini Business Services (India) Limited (CGBSL)  [formerly Unilever India Shared Services Limited (UISSL)]. UISSL was the in-house BPO unit of HUL. Cap Gemini SA and HUL entered into an agreement in September 2006, for sale of 51% controlling stake of HUL in UISSL. Post dilution, UISSL was renamed as Capgemini Business Services (India) Limited. In terms of a separate agreement entered in October 2006 and subsequent amendments thereto, both parties further agreed for dilution of the balance 49% stake of HUL in favour of Cap Gemini SA by 31st March 2010. Accordingly, HUL has now divested its 49% stake in CGBSL in favour of Cap Gemini SA".

The Board of Directors has, today, approved the appointment of Mr. Pradeep Banerjee through resolution passed by circulation. Mr. Pradeep Banerjee, aged 51, joined Hindustan Unilever Limited as a Management Trainee in 1980. He has held a series of assignments in Supply Chain, Research and Development and Categories in the Company. He became the Vice President -Technical (HPC) in HUL in 2003 and then moved to UK in 2005 as Vice President-Global Supply Chain for personal care category. He, thereafter, moved to Singapore as Vice President for Global Procurement in 2008.

SUBJECT: Increase in paid-up Capital
DETAILS: Hindustan Unilever Limited has informed the Exchange regarding the details of the increase in the Paid-up Capital of the Company as under:- Authorised Capital - Rs. 2,25,00,00,000; Existing Paid-up Capital - 218,00,71,057 Equity share of Re. 1 each; Shares allotted/ increased by - 4,69,003 Equity share of Re. 1 each; Revised Paid-up Capital - 218,05,40,060  Equity share of Re. 1 each. The Existing Issued capital - 221,03,06,829 Equity share of Re. 1 each; Shares allotted/ increased by - 4,69,003 Equity share of Re. 1 each; Revised Issued capital - 221,07,75,832 Equity share of Re. 1 each. The difference between issued capital and Paid-up capital is due to the Buyback made from open market as per Special Resolution passed through Postal Ballot on September 14, 2007. The total number of shares bought back under the Scheme were 3,02,35,772. The new shares rank pari passu in all respects with the existing capital. Further, the Committee of the Board, at its meeting held on June 19, 2009, has allotted 4,69,003  Equity Shares of Re. 1/- each under ESOP. Therefore, the paid-up capital of the Company has increased to 218,05,40,060  shares & the Issued capital has increased to 221,07,75,832  shares.

SUBJECT: Dividend/Book Closure/Date of AGM/Others
DETAILS: Hindustan Unilever Limited has informed the Exchange that the Board of Directors of the Company at its meeting held on May 10, 2009, the Board recommended a final dividend of Rs. 4.00 per share for the fifteen months period ended March 31, 2009 on Equity Shares of Re. 1/- each. Further, the company has earlier paid an interim dividend of Rs. 3.50 per share on August 18, 2008. The total dividend for the said period amounts to Rs. 7.50 per equity share of face value of Re. 1/- each. The final dividend, subject to approval of shareholders, will be paid to the shareholders on or after July 06, 2009. The Annual General Meeting of the Company will be held on July 03, 2009.The Register of Members of the Company will be close from June 16, 2009 to July 02, 2009 (both days inclusive) for the purpose of payment of Final Dividend and Annual General Meeting of the Company.

SUBJECT: Change in Financial Year / others
DETAILS: Hindustan Unilever Limited has informed the Exchange that the Board of Directors of the Company in their meeting held on July 25, 2008, the Company has changed its Accounting Year to commence from 1st April of every year and end on 31 March of the following year. Consequently, the current financial year will comprise of period of 15 months commencing from 1st January, 2008 and ending 31 March, 2009.The Board of Directors have approved the appointment of Mr. Gopal Vittal, Executive Director - HPC as member of the Board of Directors effective 1st September, 2008. The Board of Directors has also taken on record and accepted the resignation of Mr. Sanjiv Kakkar, Executive Director, Sales & Customer Development w.e.f 1st September,2008 consequent his elevation to as Chairman, Unilever Russia, Ukraine and Belarus (RUB).

The Record Date for determining the shareholders who will be entitled to receive the aforesaid dividend has been fixed as August 05, 2008 and the same will be paid on or after August 18, 2008.

Further, Mr. V. Narayanan, Non Executive Independent Director, has ceased to be a Director of the Company after not seeking re-appointment at the Annual General Meeting held on 4th April, 2008, on his attaining the age of 70 years. The members of the Company have approved the appointment of Dr. R.A. Mashelkar as Non Executive Independent Director of the Company to fill up the vacancy caused by the retirement of Mr.V.Narayanan".

SUBJECT: Appointment/Resignation
DETAILS: Hindustan Unilever Limited has informed the Exchange that: "Mr. Douglas Baillie, CEO and Managing Director of the Company, consequent to his elevation to the Unilever Executive and taking over the role of President, Western Europe, has stepped down as Director of the Company after conclusion of the Annual General Meeting of the Company on 4th April, 2008. The Board of Directors of the Company has taken on record the resignation of Mr. Douglas Baillie in their Meeting held on 4th April, 2008. The Board of Directors in same Meeting, held after conclusion of the Annual General Meeting, has also approved the elevation of Mr. D. Sundaram as the Vice-Chairman of the Company, and appointed Mr. Dhaval Buch, who is presently Executive Director for Supply Chain, as an Additional Director on the Board of the Company".

SUBJECT: Increase in paid-up Capital
DETAILS: Hindustan Unilever Limited has informed the Exchange regarding the details of the increase in the Paid-up Capital of the Company as under:- Authorised Capital - Rs. 2,25,00,00,000; Existing Paid-up Capital - 217,79,24,566 Equity share of Re. 1 each; Shares allotted/increased by - 59,000 Equity share of Re. 1 each; Revised Paid-up Capital - 217,79,83,566 Equity share of Re. 1 each. The existing Issued capital - 220,81,60,338 Equity share of Re. 1 each; Shares allotted/increased by - 59,000 Equity share of Re. 1 each; Revised Issued capital - 220,82,19,338 Equity share of Re. 1 each. The difference between issued capital and paid up capital is due to the Buy back made from open Market as per Special Resolution passed through Postal Ballot on September 14, 2007. The total number of shares bought back under the Scheme were 3,02,35,772.  The new shares rank pari passu in all respects with the existing capital. Further, the Committee of the Board, at its meeting held on March 19, 2008, has allotted 59,000 Equity Shares of Re. 1/- each under ESOP. Therefore, the paid-up capital of the Company has increased to 217,79,83,566 shares & the Issued capital has increased to 220,82,19,338 shares.

SUBJECT: Outcome of Board Meeting
DETAILS: Hindustan Unilever Limited has informed the Exchange that the Board of Directors in their meeting held on February 13, 2008 have: 1) Adopted the Annual Accounts for the year ended December 31, 2007. The Company's turnover net of excise was Rs. 13,717.75 Crores recording an increase of 13.3% on the turnover of Rs. 12,103.39 Crores in 2006. The Profit before Tax was Rs. 2,184.52 Crores as against Rs. 1,861.68 Crores in 2006. Depreciation/amortisation for the year was Rs. 138.36 Crores as against Rs.130.16 Crores in 2006. Provision for taxation (including deferred tax) is Rs. 417.14 Crores (2006 - Rs. 321.80 Crores). Profit after Tax increased to Rs. 1,769.06 Crores (2006 - Rs. 1,539.67 Crores). Exceptional Items (net of tax) for 2007 amounted to a gain of Rs. 156.41 Crores (2006 - Rs.315.70 Crores). Net Profit stood at Rs. 1,925.47 Crores (2006 - Rs. 1,855.37 Crores). 2) considered the notice received under Section 257 of the Companies Act, 1956 for appointment of Dr. R. A. Mashelkar as a Non Executive Independent Director of the Company. The Board has recommended the appointment of Dr. R. A. Mashelkar for approval of the members of the Company. Dr. Mashelkar who is an eminent Scientist and Engineer and is presently the President of the Indian National Science Academy (INSA) and President of Global Research Alliance, a network of publicity funded R&D institute from Asia Pacific, Europe & U. S. A. will be appointed as a Director of the Company after approval of members in the forthcoming Annual General Meeting of the Company. 3) The Board has also noted that Mr. V. Narayanan, Non-Executive, Independent Director of the Company on attaining the age of 70 years will not be seeking re-appointment at the forthcoming Annual General Meeting.

SUBJECT: Dividend/Book Closure/Date of AGM
DETAILS: Hindustan Unilever Limited has informed the Exchange that the Board of Directors in their meeting held on February 13, 2008 have: (1) Recommended a final dividend of Rs.3.00 per share for the year ended December 31, 2007 on Equity shares of Re.1 each. The Company has earlier paid an interim dividend of Rs.3/- per share in August 2007 and a special Platinum Jubilee Dividend of Rs.3/- per share in November 2007. The total dividend for the year ended 31 December, 2007, including the proposed final dividend, amounts to Rs.9.00 per equity share of face value of Re.1/- each. The final dividend, subject to approval of shareholders, will be paid to the shareholders on or after April 08, 2008. (2) Decided to hold the Annual General Meeting on April 04, 2008 (3) Resolved to close the Register of Members of the Company from March 19, 2008 to April 03, 2008 (both days inclusive) for the purpose of payment of Final Dividend and Annual General Meeting of the Company.

SUBJECT: Public Announcement - Buyback of Shares
DETAILS: HSBC Securities and Capital Markets (India) Private Limited has informed the Exchange regarding a Public Announcement made pursuant to the provisions of Regulation 8(1) read with Regulation 15(c) of the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Buy-back of Securities) Regulations, 1998, as amended and contains disclosures as specified in Schedule II to these Regulations. Offer for Buy-back of Equity Shares from Open Market through Stock Exchange(s). The offer & Buy-back Price:Hindustan Unilever Limited ("HUF" or the "Company") hereby announces its intension to Buy-Back its fully paid-up equity shares of face value of Re.1/- each("Equity Shares") from the existing registered shareholders/beneficial owners of the Equity shares of HUL("Buy-back") through the open market using the nationwide electronic trading facilities of the Bombay Stock Exchange Limited("BSE") and the National Stock Exchange of India Limited("NSE"), Pursuant to Article 169A of the Articles of Association of the Company and in accordance with sections 77A, 77AA and 77B of the Companies Act, 1956 ("the Act") and the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Buy-back of Securities) Regulations , 1998 ("the buy-back Regulations") at a price not exceeding Rs.230/- per Equity Share ("Maximum Offer Price") payable in cash, for an aggregate amount not exceeding Rs.630 crores ("Offer Size")i.e. within 25% of the existing Paid up Equity Share Capital and Free Reserve of the Company as on December 31, 2006 (the date of the last audited accounts)". (1) Date of commencement of the Buy-back is October 03, 2007. (2) Last Date for the Buy-back is September 13, 2008 or when HUL has completed Buy-back to the extent of Rs.630 crores under the Buy-back or such other date as may be determined by the Company at anytime even if the maximum limit of Buy-back of shares has not been reached (by giving appropriate notice for such earlier date, if any), whichever is earlier. A copy of the Public Announcement shall be available on the NSE website (http://www.nseindia.com) under: Corporates > Latest Announcements and on the Extranet Server (/Common/Corporate Announcements). For more details click here.

SUBJECT: Retirement
DETAILS: Hindustan Lever Ltd. has informed the Exchange that: "Mr. M. K. Sharma, Vice-Chairman & Wholetime Director and Mr. S. Ravindranath, Managing Director - Foods, are retiring from the services of the Company, upon attaining the age of superannuation, with effect from May 31, 2007 and April 30, 2007 respectively. Accordingly, both Mr. Sharma and Mr. Ravindranath are not seeking re-election at the forthcoming Annual General Meeting of the Company. As of May 19, 2007 there will be two vacancies on the Board due to retirement of Mr. S. Ravindranath on April 30, 2007 and Mr. M. K. Sharma ceasing to be a Director on the conclusion of AGM on May 18, 2007. To fill up the vacancies caused by the retirement of Mr. Sharma and Mr. Ravindranath, the Company proposes to appoint Mr. Nitin Paranjape and Mr. Sanjiv Kakkar as Wholetime Directors of the Company".

SUBJECT: Merger/Demerger
DETAILS: Hindustan Lever Ltd. had informed the Exchange regarding the minutes of the proceedings of the Court Convened Meetings of the Company held on October 30, 2006 to approve: i) the Scheme of Arrangement involving Amalgamation of Modern Food Industries (India) Limited and Modern Food and Nutrition Industries Limited with Hindustan Lever Limited and ii) the Scheme of Arrangement between Hindustan Lever Limited, Shamnagar Estates Private Limited, Jamnagar Properties Private Limited and Hindustan Kwality Walls Foods Private Limited for the transfer of certain Units of Hindustan Lever Limited to Shamnagar Estates Private Limited, Jamnagar Properties Private Limited and Hindustan Kwality Walls Foods Private Limited respectively. The company has now informed the Exchange that: "With all the requisite approvals having been obtained, and filing of Orders with Registrar of Companies, the process of : (i) merger of Modern Food Industries (India) Limited (MFIL) & Modern Food and Nutrition Industries Limited (MFNIL) with Hindustan Lever Limited (HLL) has been completed on 30th March, 2007. It may be noted that in so far as MFIL is concerned, HLL, the Transferee Company holds 100% of the Issued and Subscribed Capital of MFIL and since MFNIL is a wholly owned subsidiary of MFIL, HLL, the transferee Company is the ultimate parent and holding Company of MFNIL and therefore consequent to the amalgamation, all the shares of MFIL and MFNIL would be cancelled and no fresh shares are proposed to be issued in terms of the Scheme of Amalgamation and hence there will be no alteration in the share capital of the Company And ii) demerger and transfer of certain Units of Hindustan Lever Limited to Shamnagar Estates Private Limited, Jamnagar Properties Private Limited and Hindustan Kwality Walls Foods Private Limited (now known as Daverashola Estates Private Limited), (the Resulting Companies) respectively, has been completed on 29th March, 2007. As per the Order, the Demerged Units as defined in the Scheme are being transferred to the Resulting Companies from Hindustan Lever Limited, the Demerged Company".

SUBJECT: Outcome of Board Meeting
DETAILS: Hindustan Lever Ltd. has informed the Exchange that at the meeting of the Board of Directors held on February 20, 2007, the Board also considered -(i) a proposal for transfer of the Undertaking of the Company engaged in the business of manufacture  and sale of marine products (including manufacturing facilities for (i) Surimi crabsticks, crabclaws, crab chunks and allied products at Chorwad  in Gujarat, (ii) fish fillet, crab, octopus, squids and allied products at Kuthiathode  in Kerala and (iii)  Salad shrimps, fish fillets and allied products at Aroor in Kerala) as a slump sale to a suitable party/ parties or to one or more of the subsidiaries of the Company (if that is required to facilitate the transfer) by way of sale or assignment at such consideration and with effect from such date as the Board of Directors of the Company may think fit; Accordingly, in compliance with Section 293 (1) (a) read with Section 192A of the Companies Act, 1956 and Companies (Passing of Resolution by Postal Ballot) Rules 2001, a notice is proposed to be issued to the shareholders for a postal ballot to seek their approval for the proposed transfer by way of an ordinary resolution and in this connection, the Board has appointed , Mr. S. R. Tata, Partner , A.F.Ferguson & Co. Chartered Accountants as the scrutinizer for conducting  the postal ballot, and on the basis of his report , the result of the postal ballot will be announced on March 31, 2007 at the Registered office of the Company at Mumbai.

SUBJECT: Outcome of Board Meeting
DETAILS: Hindustan Lever Ltd. has informed the Exchange that at the Board Meeting of Modern Food and Nutrition Industries Limited (MFNIL) held on September 12, 2006, the Directors of MFNIL have approved the proposal for merger of MFNIL (a 100% subsidiary of Modern Food Industries Limited) with the Company, with effect from October 01, 2006. Draft Schemes, setting out the terms and conditions with regard to the above were duly approved by the Board in the said meeting and steps are now being taken to obtain the approval of the shareholders and the Hon'ble High Court of Judicature at Bombay and at Delhi for the Scheme of Amalgamation of MFNIL with the Company.

SUBJECT: Scheme of Amalgamation/Arrangement/Demerger
DETAILS: Hindustan Lever Ltd. has informed the Exchange that at the Board meeting held on September 08,2006, the Directors of the Company, inter alia, approved the proposal for (i) Merger of Modern Food Industries Limited (MFIL) and its subsidiary Modern Food and Nutrition Industries Limited (MFNIL) with the Company, with effect from October 01,2006. In terms of the Scheme of Amalgamation the entire shareholding of the two companies would stand cancelled and accordingly no valuation exercise or recommendation of share exchange ratio was made. (ii) Demerger of the non-functional factory land at Shamnagar and Jamnagar and the vacant leasehold land at Daverashola into three separate resulting Companies, being 100% subsidiaries of the Company, with effect from October 01,2006, for consideration by way of subscription to the shares of the respective Resulting Companies. Draft Schemes, setting out the terms and conditions with regard to the above were duly approved by the Board in the said meeting and steps are now being taken to obtain the approval of the shareholders and the Hon'ble High Court of Judicature at Bombay and at Delhi for the Scheme of Amalgamation of MFIL and MFNIL with the Company. The Company is also taking steps for the demerger proposal by way of filing an application pursuant to Section 391 to 394 of the Companies Act, for approval of the Scheme of Arrangement with the Companies and their respective members. The company has further informed the Exchange that MFIL at its Board Meeting held on September 08,2006 approved the proposal for its amalgamation with Hindustan Lever Limited while the board meeting of MFNIL in this regard is scheduled to be held on September 11,2006.

DETAILS: Hindustan Lever Ltd. has informed the Exchange regarding a press release issued by the company on May 26,2006 in connection with divestment of 49% equity share capital of Quest International India Limited held by Hindustan Lever Limited as follows : "Hindustan Lever Limited (HLL) has today divested its holding of 49% of equity share capital of Quest Internationa1 India Limited (QIIL). HLL had transferred the flavours and fragrances business into QIIL in 2001 and the majority shareholding in QIIL (51%) acquired by ICI India and its associates in 2001. Out of the total of 2,880,000 equity shares of QIIL, HLL had continued to hold 1,411,200 equity shares. HLL sold these shares to ICI India today for a consideration of Rs. 54 crores. With  this divestment,QIIL ceases to be a Joint Venture company of HLL."

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: Hindustan Lever Ltd. has informed the Exchange that the Company has transferred its entire shareholding in its 100% subsidiary Tea Estates India Limited ("TEIL") to Maxwell Golden Tea Private Limited ("MGT"), a Woodbriar Group company on March 01, 2006. TEIL owns 8 tea estates and 6 factories for processing tea in the high-yielding belt of Tamilnadu with an average annual output of approx. 10,500 metric tons. Woodbriar Group has interests in plantations, insurance services and real estate. The Group's gardens are spread across the premium tea growing regions in Tamilnadu and Kerala. HLL management believes that the proposed transfer to Woodbriar Group is in the best interests of the tea plantation business and all its stakeholders. Existing terms and conditions of services of all TEIL employees will be fully protected in accordance with applicable laws and terms of their employment. The acquisition of TEIL by Woodbriar Group will provide scale and bring in synergy benefits to Woodbriar Group, as a large portion of TEIL gardens are contiguous to the existing tea gardens of Woodbriar Group, Canara Bank, Maduari Circle has funded the debt component to Woodbriar Group for this acquisition. With this disposal of shareholding in TEIL, HLL has completed its exit from its tea plantations business both in South India and Assam. It may be recalled that HLL has sold its interests in Rossell Industries Limited and Doom Dooma Tea Company Limited in Assam during the last 12 months. DSP Merrill Lynch Limited acted as financial advisor to Hindustan Lever Limited.

SUBJECT: Scheme of Arrangement/Others
DETAILS: Hindustan Lever Ltd. has informed the Exchange that with all the requisite approvals having been obtained, and filing of Order with the Registrar of Companies, the Scheme of Arrangement (Scheme) involving Amalgamation of Vashisti Detergents Limited (VDL) with Hindustan Lever Limited (HLL) has become effective. The Scheme will be operative from the Appointed Date, i.e. July 01, 2005. Pursuant to the said Scheme, those VDL Shareholders whose names appear in its Register of Members as on a Record Date, would be eligible for 1 Equity Share of Re.1/- of HLL for every 10 Equity Shares of Rs.10/- each held in VDL and interim dividend @ 2.50 per share declared by HLL for the year 2005.

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: Hindustan Lever Ltd. has informed the Exchange that the Record Date for entitlement of HLL (Hindustan Lever Limited) Shares to VDL (Vashisti Detergents Limited) Shareholders, has been fixed as March 31, 2006.

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: Hindustan Lever Ltd. has informed the Exchange that Hindustan Lever Limited (HLL) and McLeod Russel India Limited (MRIL) on January 23, 2006 completed the transaction for transfer of HLL's 100% shareholding in Doom Dooma Tea Company Limited (DDTCL). In December 2005, both the companies had entered into a Memorandum of Understanding for the above transaction after which approval from shareholders of Mcleod Russel India Limited was sought and received on January 20, 2006. Accordingly, with effect from January 23, 2006, Doom Dooma Tea Company Limited ceases to be a subsidiary of HLL.

SUBJECT: Scheme of Amalgamation

The Orders have been filed with the Registrar of Companies, Maharashtra, Mumbai on December 30, 2005, making it effective, with retrospective effect from the Appointed Date, viz January 01, 2005 in case of Lipton India Exports Limited, International Fisheries Limited and Merryweather Food Products Limited and April 01, 2005 in case of Lever India Exports Limited and TOC Disinfectants Limited.

SUBJECT: Scheme of Amalgamation

The company has now informed that the earlier information needs to be ignored and the revised information is as follows: The Hon'ble High Court at Bombay has passed Orders on November 25, 2005 and the said Orders were issued on December 02, 2005, approving the Scheme of Amalgamation of Lever India Exports Limited, Lipton India Exports Limited, Merryweather Food Products Limited, TOC Disinfectants Limited and International Fisheries Limited with Hindustan Lever Limited. SUBJECT: Memorandum of Understanding
DETAILS: Hindustan Lever Ltd. has informed the Exchange that Hindustan Lever Limited (HLL) and McLeod Russel India Limited (MRIL) on December 13, 2005 signed a Memorandum of Understanding for transfer of HLL's 100% shareholding in Doom Dooma Tea Company Limited (DDTCL). DDTCL owns 7 tea estates in Tinsukia district of Assam with a tea planted area of approx 3100 hectares and 3 factories to process tea. The average output from these tea estates has been approx. 6000 metric tons. The tea gardens of DDTCL are in the quality belt of Assam and are in close proximity to the tea gardens of MRIL group. The agreed consideration is Rs. 69 crores plus net current assets as on December 31, 2005. The existing terms and conditions of services of all DDTCL employees will be fully protected in accordance with applicable laws and terms of their employment. HLL management believes that the proposed transfer to MRIL, a lead industry player in tea plantations, is in the best interest of the business and all its stakeholders. The acquisition of DDTCL by MRIL will bring in more synergy benefits to MRIL and shall enable MRIL to realize better prices for their teas both in domestic and overseas markets. The transaction is expected to be completed in January 2006 post receipt of approval from shareholders of M/s McLeod Russel India Limited. It may be recalled that pursuant to a Scheme of arrangement approved by the Hon'ble High Court of Judicature at Bombay vide their order dated October 07, 2005, HLL had transferred its tea plantation business in the state of Assam to Doom Dooma Tea Company Limited (DDTCL) with effect from April 01, 2005.

SUBJECT: Scheme of Arrangement

The said drawn up Orders have been filed with the Registrar of Companies, Maharashtra, Mumbai on December 01, 2005, making it effective from December 01, 2005, with retrospective effect from the Appointed Date, April 01, 2005.

Fergueson & Co. and Mr.R.Ganapathy, a shareholder/Senior Manager with a firm of practicing company secretaries, scrutineers appointed for the EGM and court convened meetings of the company, submitted their report on October 20,2005 to the Chairman appointed by the court and the results were announced to the shareholders on the same day. Court Convened Meeting(Approval of the Scheme of arrangement involving Amalgamation of Vashisti Detergents Limited with Hindustan Lever Limited):Valid Ballots-545;Invalid Ballots-17 and Total Ballots-562. The resolution has been approved by the requisite majority in number and value, present and voting either in person or proxy, as required by the provisions of section 391 to 394 of the Companies Act,1956. 2. Extraordinary General Meeting(Allotment of new equity shares to the shareholders of Vashisti Detergents Limited pursuant to the proposed Scheme of Amalgamation):No. of shares for the resolution-118,28,43,214(99.99%) and No. of shares against the resolution-1,15,405(0.01%). The Resolution has been approved by an overwhelming majority.

SUBJECT: Outcome of meeting
DETAILS: Hindustan Lever Ltd. has informed the Exchange that the Hon'ble High Court of Judicature of Bombay had convened three separate meetings of the shareholders of Hindustan Lever Limited (HLL) on July 29, 2005 to approve the following proposals: (1) The Scheme of Amalgamation of Lever India Exports Limited, Lipton India Exports Limited, Merryweather Food Products Limited, TOC Disinfectants Limited and International Fisheries Limited with HLL; (2) The Scheme of Arrangement between Hindustan Lever Limited, Tea Estates India Limited for the demerger and transfer of TEI Division (Tamil Nadu) of Hindustan Lever Limited to Tea Estates India Limited; (3) The Scheme of Arrangement between Hindustan Lever Limited, Doom Dooma Tea Company Limited for the demerger and transfer of the Tea Plantation Division (Assam) of Hindustan Lever Limited to Doom Dooma Tea Company Ltd.  The Joint scrutineers, appointed by the Chairman of the meetings, communicated the outcome of the polls to the Chairman which were conducted after poll persons had a chance to speak on the merger. The shareholders accorded approval to all the three proposals by overwhelming majority. The results of the poll shall be available on the NSE website (http://www.nseindia.com) under: Corporates > Latest Announcements and on the Extranet Server (/Common/CorporateAnnouncements).

SUBJECT: Divestment of Shares
DETAILS: Hindustan Lever Ltd. has informed the Exchange that Unilever Overseas Holdings BV (UOHBV), the Netherlands based wholly owned subsidiary of Unilever PLC divested 37,00,000 equity shares Rs. 10/- each of Rossell Industries Limited (RIL) In favour of M/s. M.K. Shah Exports Limited, one of the leading exporter and tea plantation company in India, being an Indian unlisted company. Simultaneously Lipton India Exports Limited (LIEL), a 100% subsidiary of Hindustan Lever Limited, also disposed of 61,85,642 equity shares of Rs.10/- each held by it in favour of the said Company. Unilever Overseas Holdings BV and Lipton India Exports Limited constituted, a little over 97.5% of the Issued and subscribed capital of Rossell Industries Limited and approx. 2.5% Is held by certain local shareholders. The Interests of the employees will be fully protected as they continue to remain employees of RIL on the existing terms and conditions. It may be recalled that RIL had come Into Unilever fold In November 1999 as a result of acquisition of non-resident Interests of Jokai Tea Holdings Limited and Lipton India Exports Limited taking over the shareholding from Y.K. Modi Group. This was followed by open tender offer under the SEBI Takeover Guidelines.  With the conclusion of this transaction, MK Shah Exports Limited will now assume control of Rossell industries Limited and Rossell Industries Limited will cease to be subsidiary of Lipton India Exports Limited and consequently of Hindustan Lever Limited. In view of the significant losses built up over the years, the transfer consideration is nominal and therefore not 'material' in the context of HLL.

SUBJECT: proposal of Amalgamation
DETAILS: Hindustan Lever Ltd. has informed the Exchange that at the Board meeting held on April 29,2005, the Directors of the Company, inter alia, approved the proposal for amalgamation of Lipton India Exports Limited, Lever India Exports Limited, Merry Weather Foods Products Limited, Toc Disinfectants Limited and International Fisheries Limited, all subsidiaries of Hindustan Lever Limited, with the Company. Subject to obtaining the requisite approvals, the Board also approved the Scheme incorporating the proposed arrangement for amalgamation of the said companies with effect from January 1, 2005 and for this purpose a Committee of Directors have been appointed, inter alia, authorising them to file to requisite applications pursuant to Section 391-394 of the Companies Act, 1956 and take all requisite steps for implementation of the Scheme. Steps are now being taken to obtain the approval of the shareholders and the Hon'ble High Court of Judicature at Bombay for the Scheme of Amalgamation. It is proposed to synchronize the court convened meetings of the shareholders for this purpose with ensuing Annual General Meeting of the Company scheduled to be held on June 24, 2005 and applications seeking direction of the High Court in this regard are being made accordingly. The company has further informed that the respective Boards of Lipton India Exports Limited, Lever India Exports Limited, Merry Weather Foods Products Limited, Toc Disinfectants Limited and International Fisheries Limited have also met on April 29, 2005 independently and have approved of the Scheme of Amalgamation of the said companies with Hindustan Lever Limited, in terms of the Scheme.

SUBJECT: Postal Ballot
DETAILS: Hindustan Lever Ltd. has informed the Exchange that the Board of Directors of the Company, by way of Circular Resolution considered two separate proposals for: 1) Transfer by way of sale its tea plantation business in Assam, commonly known as the Doom Dooma Division to a wholly owned subsidiary of the Company; 2) Transfer by way of sale its tea plantation business in Tamil Nadu, commonly known as the Tea Estates Division to a wholly owned subsidiary of the Company. Pursuant to in principle approval of the Board for transfer of the aforesaid business at such consideration and with effect from such date as the Board of Directors of the Company may determine, in compliance with Section 293 (1)(a) read with Section 192A of the Companies Act, 1956, and Companies (Passing of Resolution by Postal Ballot) Rules 2001, a notice is proposed to be issued to the shareholders for a postal ballot to seek their approval for the proposed transfers by way of ordinary resolutions. The Company has appointed Mr. S. R. Tata, Partner, M/s. A. F. Ferguson & Company, Chartered Accountants, as Scrutinizer for conducting the postal ballot process. The duly completed postal ballot form should reach the Scrutinizer on or before May 12, 2005 and the results of the postal ballot will be announced on May 16, 2005. A copy of the Notice and Explanatory Statement shall be available on the NSE website (http://www.nseindia.com) under: Corporates > Latest Announcements and on the Extranet Server (/Common/CorporateAnnouncements).

SUBJECT: Results of Postal Ballot
DETAILS: Hindustan Lever Ltd. has informed the Exchange that the Company was proposing to seek approval of members by way of postal ballot, for transfer of undertakings involved in the  manufacture of (i) Soap and Soap intermediaries at Haji Bunder, Sewri, Mumbai & (ii)functionalized biopolymers business including manufacturing facilities at Pondicherry. The Company has now informed the Exchange of the results of the postal ballot as per the report of the Scrutinizer, the details of which are as follows :  Ordinary Resolutions under section 293(1)(a) of the Companies Act,1956 for transfer of undertakings engaged in:A)manufacture of  Soap and Soap intermediaries at Haji Bunder, Sewri, Mumbai:1)Votes in favour of the Resolution-125,72,75,595 and 2)Votes against the Resolution-7,85,79,774. B) Functionalized biopolymers business including manufacturing facilities at Pondicherry: 1) Votes in favour of the Resolution-125,54,81,796,2)Votes against the Resolution-7,83,39,747. Both the resolutions were thus approved with 94% votes.

SUBJECT: Postal Ballot
DETAILS: Hindustan Lever Ltd. has informed the Exchange that pursuant to Section 192A of the Companies Act, 1956, the Company is seeking the Members' consent to the following Resolutions proposed to be passed by Postal Ballot : 1) Transfer by way of sale or otherwise its undertaking involved in the manufacture of soap and soap intermediaries at Haji Bunder, Sewri, Mumbai, Maharashtra to one of its subsidiaries;2)Transfer by way of sale its functionalized biopolymers business including manufacturing facilities at Pondicherry to a suitable third party or to a subsidiary. The duly completed Postal Ballot Forms should reach the Scrutinizer on or before December 24,2004 and the result of the postal ballot will be announced on December 30, 2004.

SUBJECT: Record Date
DETAILS: Hindustan Lever Ltd. has informed the Exchange that the Company has announced December 01, 2004 as the record date for redemption of Secured Fully Redeemable 9% Non-Convertible Bonus Debentures of Rs.6/- each issued by the Company in July 2003, at the conclusion of 18-month term of the said Debentures on December 31, 2004, together with interest for the 6-month period ending with the date of redemption. Accordingly from December 01, 2004, the said Debentures will cease to be a trading security. Debentureholders holding debentures in physical form need not surrender the Debenture Certificate to the Company.
